name: Maserati Internal Platform Codes
description: Reference list of Maserati internal project codes for identifying parts compatibility.

name: Maserati Touch Control (MTC) / Uconnect
description: The infotainment system in the Ghibli (M157), Quattroporte VI (M156), and Levante (M161) is a re-skinned Chrysler Uconnect 8.4 system.
specs: Source: Chrysler 300, Dodge Charger, Jeep Grand Cherokee

Notes: While the hardware is Panasonic/Harman and shared, the firmware is Maserati-specific. You cannot simply plug a Dodge unit in without reprogramming/unlocking, but screens and digitizers are often interchangeable for repairs.

name: Window & Mirror Switches (Ghibli/Levante)
description: Master window switches and mirror controls in M156/M157/M161 are direct parts bin shares from the Chrysler/Dodge lineup.
specs: Source: Dodge Charger (2011+), Chrysler 300, Jeep Grand Cherokee
Notes: Look for the version with power folding mirrors if your Maserati has them.

name: GranTurismo Window Switches
description: The M145 GranTurismo uses window switches that are shared with the Alfa Romeo MiTo and some Fiat models, and surprisingly, the Dodge Dart (later years) / Chrysler 200.
specs: Part: Single Window Switch / Mirror Knob
Source: Alfa Romeo MiTo, Fiat Punto, Dodge Dart (2013+)
Notes: The 'sticky button' issue common in Maseratis can be fixed by swapping the plastic covers from the cheaper Fiat/Dodge parts.

name: ZF 8HP Transmission Parts
description: Modern Maseratis use the ZF 8HP70 or 8HP50 transmission. Service parts are identical to BMW, Dodge, and Jaguar.
specs: ZF Price: ~$100 for OEM ZF pan
Fluid: ZF Lifeguard 8 (Shell L12108) - same as BMW ATF 3+, Mopar 8 & 9 Speed ATF.

name: Engine Start/Stop Button
description: The 'Engine Start' button in the Ghibli and Levante is the same part used in the Jeep Grand Cherokee and Chrysler 300, just with a different bezel or cap sometimes.
specs: Notes: If the switch fails, the Mopar part is a direct functional replacement.

name: HVAC Blend Door Actuators
description: The clicking noise in your Maserati dashboard is likely a failed blend door actuator. These are standard Valeo or Bosch parts used across the FCA (Stellantis) lineup.
specs: Source: Dodge Charger, Chrysler 300, Jeep Grand Cherokee
Notes: Verify the part number on the sticker (e.g., Bosch number) to confirm the rotation range.

name: Cambiocorsa / F1 Pump (M138)
description: The hydraulic pump for the Cambiocorsa transmission in the 4200 GT / Spyder is a Magneti Marelli part shared with Ferrari and Alfa Romeo.
specs: Part: Selespeed / F1 Pump Electric Motor
Source: Alfa Romeo 156 Selespeed, Fiat Stilo Abarth
Notes: You can often replace just the electric motor (from an Alfa Selespeed pump) rather than the entire hydraulic assembly, saving thousands.

name: Biturbo Era Interchange
description: Parts for the Biturbo era (Biturbo, 222, 430, Spyder) are often shared with other Italian cars of the 80s.
specs: Alternator: Often Bosch, shared with BMW E30 or similar era European cars.
Fuse Box: Known weak point, uses standard ceramic fuses.
Steering Rack: Some models used a rack similar to the BMW E21 (check mounting).

name: V6 (F160) Oil Filter
description: The oil filter for the Maserati V6 (Ghibli/Levante) is specific, but the housing design is similar to other FCA Pentastar applications. However, DO NOT use a Pentastar filter blindly.
specs: Notes: While the engine block is cast by Chrysler, the internals are Ferrari. Stick to the OEM or high-quality aftermarket (UFI, Mahle) specified for Maserati. The 'Maserati Tax' here is real but risking a $20k engine for a $10 filter is not recommended.

name: Suspension Air Compressor (Levante)
description: The air suspension compressor on the Levante is a WABCO unit.
specs: Notes: The WABCO unit is identical. You might need to swap the electrical connector or mounting bracket, but the pump itself is the same.
